abstract: Republican legislators in Wisconsin rush to approve right-to-work measure, cutting short testimony in response to protestors' threat to disrupt proceedings; bill allows private sector, nonunion workers to opt out of dues equivalent, known as 'fair share' payments, in effect weakening unions' collective bargaining power.
lead_paragraph: In a hurried roll call as protesters chanted in opposition, legislators voted to advance to the full Senate a bill that would bar unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

headline.main: Word of Threat Cuts Short Hearing on Right-to-Work Measure in Wisconsin
headline.print_headline: Word of Threat Cuts Short Hearing on Right-to-Work Measure in Wisconsin

snippet: In a hurried roll call as protesters chanted in opposition, legislators voted to advance to the full Senate a bill that would bar unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
